content.description: Straightforward climbing on low-angle rock. There's a massive loose block at the top which makes traversing right to the anchors of Jewel a better idea than topping out. These shinanigans, mixed with the unexciting climbing, make this route one to skip.
content.location: Follows the obvious crack to the right of Cramps and left of Jewel

content.description: Formerly a 5.8 crack called trad ramp, two bolts were added to create sport tamp. All feet with an undercling for balance as you work right to the first bolt. From there its slightly runout but easy climbing past a second bolt to the anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts, 2 bolt chain anchor. The first bolt is fairly high on top of a bulge in the rock.
content.location: 2nd route from the right on Radical Wall. Its the bolted crack.

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt. Powerful moves to a sidepull and strenuous climbing to the good holds above the shallow roof. Easier climbing to the chains above.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Towards the right side of Radical Wall and goes up the middle of the shallow roof that has a small tree on its right side. The route that goes just to the right of that small tree is One Step.

content.description: An interesting climb that gets easier once you know the sequence through the unique crux about half way up. This route is one of the best at New Canyon.
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: About the middle of Radical Wall. Look for the two bolts closely spaced and offset at the bottom. About 5 feet right of a gray water streak running down the wall. (Jewel is the route in the water streak).

content.description: Interesting climbing with good holds to the large ledge above, one more bolt and low angle easy climbing above to the chains.
content.location: On the far right side of Radical Wall, 5 feet before the wall curves around the corner to Bulge Wall.

content.description: Climbing through the sharp crimpers past the first bolt leads to easy climbing with good left handholds for clipping. Easier if you stay left.
content.location: Starts to the right of a large crack (wasp).

content.description: Super fun climbing trough the roof at the top.
content.protection: 3 bolts to two bolt anchor with chains. Rap from the chains to avoid the edges on the roof.
content.location: On the far left side of Radical Wall

content.description: The climbing on Radical Wall is a little mix of everything. Cramps is very short juggy overhang, Wasp is low angle trad, Rad is a thought provoking face climb, and S&M requires power and finger strength. Both Cramps and Rad are probably the best climbs on this wall and some of the better climbs at New Canyon.
